name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
The U.S. Supreme Court on Friday (January 17) rejected TikTok's appeal against the "Sell or Ban" bill, upholding Congress's ban on TikTok. This may result in 170 million users in the United States being unable to continue using TikTok after the 19th.
The Supreme Court ruled that the law did not violate the right to free speech under the First Amendment of the U.S. Constitution, and that the U.S. government's national security concerns about Chinese companies that own TikTok were reasonable.
The court wrote in an unsigned opinion: "There is no doubt that for more than 170 million Americans, TikTok provides a unique and extensive channel of expression, participation, and community. But Congress has determined that divestiture is necessary to address its national security concerns about TikTok's data collection and relationship with foreign adversaries."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Currently, the international version of Xiaohongshu has been released. In addition to being able to log in with WeChat and QQ, the international version also supports logging in with Google and Facebook accounts. The data of the international and domestic versions are interoperable, but the international version currently does not have a translation function.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Recently, Panhua Insurance Hunan Branch launched an "employee welfare" financial product, which pays principal and interest annually.
The company said that even if you don't understand finance, you can get the principal and interest returned on time. For this benefit that is guaranteed to make money, many employees invested their life savings and bought the company's financial products, but since the beginning of last year, the company has been unable to pay the principal and interest.
A victim told the police who were maintaining stability, "I have lost all my property now, and I am not afraid of anything now"

content: January 16, Qingdao, Shandong. Detai Construction Company owed workers wages. Workers knelt on the ground and held up a cardboard to demand their wages. The cardboard read: "Migrant workers with cancer, demanding wages to save their lives, give me back the money I spent to save my life"

The netizen was immediately banned by Anhui Fire Department.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On January 17, in the United Arab Emirates, a man attended an overseas exhibition and found the flag of the Republic of China on the booth of a Taiwanese manufacturer. He then covered the flag of the Republic of China with the five-star red flag; On January 13, in Italy, a man questioned the wrong style of the flag on the self-service machine at Milan Airport.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On January 17, local time, TikTok said that unless the Biden administration "immediately makes a clear statement" to ensure that the ban is not enforced: TikTok will be forced to close on the 19th. On the same day, TikTok CEO Zhou Shouzi thanked Trump for his efforts to find a solution to allow TikTok to continue to be used in the United States.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On January 16, Chengdu, Sichuan, it was revealed online that an employee of the "Shaohuopu Jixiang Hotpot" restaurant on Shuangfu Road urinated in the back kitchen. On January 17, the official announcement: The person involved admitted that he had done so. The restaurant has been closed and the Municipal Supervision Bureau has filed a case against him.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Phoenix Weekly reported that the documentary director "Hua Zong" said: They may be carrying out fraudulent activities while donating money to their hometown and building roads.
When the domestically-made "sixth-generation aircraft" made its maiden flight some time ago, there were still fraudsters setting off fireworks in the park. They felt very excited and proud of the motherland's strong rejuvenation.

content: On January 16, a medical worker from Fushun compared doctors to construction contractors and medical insurance to developers, and gave a popular explanation of the so-called DRG cost control and the essence of medical insurance reform.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On January 12, construction workers in Jinshan District, Shanghai, were demanding their wages and had an argument with the police: "They don't even pay us our hard-earned money, why are you (the police) coming to us? The police are supposed to serve the people."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On January 16, an American netizen posted on Xiaohongshu, asking what the life of Chinese workers is like and whether they can afford cars and houses.
A woman asked for help in the comment section, saying that she was a nurse who had also gone to Wuhan to fight the epidemic in 2020. Now she has spent all her money to treat her child. "The doctor said that if I don't renew the subscription, the child will be in danger. I have served countless patients with my professionalism and enthusiasm. Now I just ask kind people to help my poor child."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: January 18, Huairen, Guizhou. Villagers in Maotai Town hold up their ID cards and beg the government to return the land they have seized.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Wang Yiqing, a member of the Hunan Provincial People's Congress, suggested increasing the proportion of Chinese patent medicines used in medical institutions to promote the high-quality development of the province's traditional Chinese medicine industry.
Wang Yiqing is the chairman of Hunan Dajiaweikang Pharmaceutical Industry Co., Ltd. The company has products such as Xiaojianzhong Granules, Isatis Root Granules, Ulcer Capsules, Xinshenghua Granules, Jiuwei Gantai Capsules, and Liuwei Dihuang Capsules.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ

A large number of security guards were at the scene. January 14th, Zhaoqing, Guangdong, villagers from Huaiji Village protested against the demolition of ancestral homes. Unknown people were holding shields at the scene.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On January 16, Guancha.com: "Japanese manhole covers are frequently stolen, with losses reaching millions of yen. Japanese media analyzed the reason: the value of metals has increased recently, and they are all stolen and sold for money." In response, many Chinese netizens said in the comment area that they stole the manhole covers themselves: "Everyone's way of being patriotic is different" "I was exhausted that day" "I worked all night, so tired"

content:
On January 14, parents from many places across the country, including Guangdong, Guiyang, and Hangzhou, gathered in front of the children's programming institution Tongcheng Tongmei stores to protest.
The owner of the children's programming institution ran away with the money on January 13, and many parents lost more than 10,000 yuan.

content: January 13, Qingdao, Shandong: Owners of Hedakeyuan moved into the unfinished building to protest, finding joy in misery

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On January 17, Hu Xijin wrote that TikTok's experience shows how bad the US business environment is for foreign investors. Some people would say that American companies such as Google, Twitter, and Facebook have no place to stand in China, but China has always welcomed American Internet companies to come to China, provided that they abide by Chinese laws.
Google does not want to be bound by Chinese laws and withdraws from the Chinese market on its own. How can it be blamed on China?

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ

January 13th, Yufeng Century Plaza, Gucheng, Xiangyang, Hubei, because the anti-rent amount was less than one-tenth of the promised amount, the owners gathered to protest and demanded repayment. An owner tried to jump off the building but was subdued by the police
January 13th, Jiatian Shangshuyuan, Zhumadian, Henan, owners gathered in front of the Economic Development Zone Management Committee to defend their rights because of the unfinished project

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On January 16, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs' official website changed the name of US Secretary of State-designate Rubio to "Rubio"
It is reported that since Rubio was elected as a senator in 2011, he has promoted and proposed a number of bills related to Hong Kong, Taiwan, and Xinjiang, including the "Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act", the "Taiwan Travel Act" and the "Uyghur Human Rights Policy Act", which were sanctioned by China twice.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Starting from March 1, Xi'anâ€™s emergency management administrative law enforcement personnel will be subject to quasi-military management.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Recently, many Weibo bloggers said that if the content published contains the three words "Myawaddy" or the content is related to Myanmar's online fraud, the post will most likely be banned from commenting.
However, Hu Xijin's Weibo post yesterday also contained the three words "Myawaddy", but was not banned from commenting. One blogger said: "Old Hu is indeed treated preferentially"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ

After watching for three days, I feel that it is difficult to be an ordinary person in the United States." Netizens in the comment area also agreed.

On January 15, He Xiaohong, a deputy to the Zhejiang Provincial People's Congress, reported that three or five young people born in the 1990s turned an abandoned mine into an Internet-famous rural coffee shop, selling 8,818 cups a day and generating revenue of more than 50 million in two years.
The report was questioned by many netizens, and currently only 5 comments remain, and the rest have been deleted.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: The Supreme People's Court and the Supreme People's Procuratorate issued the "Interpretation on Several Issues Concerning the Application of Law in Handling Criminal Cases of Assaulting Police Officers", Article 8 of which stipulates that attacking auxiliary police officers does not constitute assaulting police officers, but is suspected of obstructing public service and is punishable by a maximum sentence of three years.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Red Star News: The director gave a greeting to the district party secretary, and his son easily made a profit of more than 70 million yuan.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Lu Changlin, a member of the Beijing CPPCC and chief physician of Chaoyang Hospital, made a proposal on centralized procurement of medical insurance, saying that the drugs purchased by centralized procurement have problems such as poor efficacy and large adverse reactions, which makes patients and doctors distrust centralized procurement drugs.
Lu Changlin gave an example in his proposal, saying that if the same dose of new oral anticoagulants is used, imported drugs can effectively prevent patients from stroke and pulmonary embolism, while patients are more likely to suffer from stroke and pulmonary embolism when using centralized procurement drugs. This makes patients and doctors distrust centralized procurement drugs.
In addition, doctors such as Lu Changlin believe that the probability of adverse reactions to centralized procurement drugs is higher than that of imported drugs or original drugs. After patients switch to centralized procurement drugs, they even have allergic reactions, indicating that the drug purity is not enough and there are problems with the manufacturing process.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On January 18 (released), at Liaoning Fangda General Hospital, several medical staff wished a dying old man a happy birthday, which triggered ridicule from netizens. The original video has been deleted.
Netizen: "He must be unhappy, but his younger generation must be very happy" "It is said that 80% of the medical insurance is used here, and the rest of the money is used to purchase traditional Chinese medicine and cheap generic drugs"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
An American "TikTok refugee" posted: Can you show me the real streets of China?
Netizens posted slogans in the comment area: "Don't let your camera become the eyes of the enemy. Leaking secrets will lead to imprisonment, and selling secrets will lead to death."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On January 16, a medical worker in a northwestern city said that the hospital where she works no longer purchases imported drugs, and that doctors need to prescribe imported drugs from pharmacies. However, the hospital has regulations that if doctors frequently prescribe imported drugs, they will be deducted points or even have their prescription rights revoked. She said that this is forcing people to take useless centralized procurement drugs. She also gave the example that taking three tablets of domestic antihypertensive drugs a day does not lower blood pressure, while taking one tablet of imported Bayxin on the same day has a good effect.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Recently, the blogger "è€å˜æ€äº†äº†äº†" of Bilibili exposed that Ni Yuancheng, an employee of Bilibili, loaded malicious code in the entire Bilibili webpage to attack specific netizens. After clicking on any video, the page of the attacked netizens will be replaced with a blank page and a prompt will pop up saying "your account has been banned".
It is currently speculated that Ni Yuancheng and other Bilibili netizens had a quarrel on the site and felt resentful, so he used his authority to load this malicious code.
In addition, Ni Yuancheng also threatened to block the netizen's account. Bilibili customer service: Please confirm the facts, a special investigation team will be set up, and the matter will be reported to the regulatory authorities.
On January 18, "è€å˜æ€äº†äº†äº†" stated that there is no progress in the incident, and the explosive video will not be pushed and cannot be found.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
According to Japanese media reports: On January 16, a Chinese man took a taxi in Osaka City and arrived at Kansai Airport. He tried to pay the 20,000 yen fare with a credit card, but failed to pay.
The man got out of the car and fled. The taxi driver chased him and was beaten by him.
Then the man quickly ran into the airport and took a plane to leave Japan.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Supporters of President Yi Seok-yeol gathered in front of the Western District Court in Seoul, South Korea, on January 18, demanding the dismissal of an illegal arrest warrant. South Korean police put their feet on people's mouths when dealing with protesters.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On January 17, a user named "Hou De Zai Wu" claimed to be Wang Feng, the county magistrate of Guangchang County, Jiangxi Province, and responded to the public's demands on Douyin. He also assured netizens that he was not a liar: "I worked from a township to a county magistrate, and my personal experience tells you that this is true!" At present, the account has been banned by the platform.
